Package org.friendsbalt.cs.adv.InterfaceArcade

Interface TwoPlayerGame

public interface TwoPlayerGame
A game which can be played by two players alternately making moves on a shared playing "board." The board need not be a rectangular plane, but some shared playing arena must exist between the two players.

A TwoPlayerGame is always played in alternate turns where victory may be achieved after either player's move. It is possible to track moves and mandate that both players have the same number of moves before allowing a winner to be declared, but care should be taken that in such cases the gameIsWon() or getWinner() methods do not prematurely return an incorrect value.

Each player move should be exhaustive of his turn. The TwoPlayerGame is an alternating game (chess for example) as opposed to a sort of "freestyle" game where turn sharing does not occur, as in soccer or a competitive sports. A players move may have multiple components or inputs, but this must be entirely contained within a single invocation of playerMove() and no reliance may be made upon a reinvocation of this method.
Thus for any instation of the TwoPlayerGame, calls to playerMove(Player.ONE and playerMove(Player.TWO may be made alternately without concern that one player's turn will not have ended.

For methods which override this method, it is possible to override either the playerOneMove() and playerTwoMove() methods or just the playerMove(Player p) method, utilizing the enum Player in this package. Note, however, that the methods for individual player moves have been deprecated so that the latter option (overriding playerMove(Player P) is strongly preferred.

In either case, it is entirely possible to invoke playerMove() as by default the playerMove() method invokes the two deprecated methods for individual players.
See Also:
TwoPlayerGame.Player

  • Method Details

    • drawBoard

      void drawBoard()
      Draws the board to the screen. This could be done using pretty println() statements or JavaFX (wow!).

    • playerOneMove

      @Deprecated default void playerOneMove() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Deprecated.
      Replaced by a call to playerMove(TwoPlayerGame.Player.ONE)
      Requests a move from the first player and makes the move.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not overriden by the implementing class.

    • playerTwoMove

      @Deprecated default void playerTwoMove() throws UnsupportedOperationException
      Deprecated.
      Replaced by a call to playerMove(TwoPlayerGame.Player.TWO)
      Requests a move from the second player and makes the move.
      Throws:
      UnsupportedOperationException - if this method is not overriden by the implementing class.

    • playerMove

      default void playerMove​(TwoPlayerGame.Player p) throws IllegalArgumentException
      Requests a move from the specified player and performs the move.
      Parameters:
      p - a Player, either one or two who's move it is.
      Throws:
      IllegalArgumentException - if a player other than 1 or 2 is passed.

    • gameIsWon

      boolean gameIsWon()
      Checks to see if one of the players has won.
      Returns:
      true if one player has won the game, false otherwise.

    • announceWinner

      void announceWinner()
      Displays the winner of the game. This could be done by printing to the command line or in some other way.
